archetype_name: Family Weekend Advanced: South African Braai & Potjie
name: Sticky Chutney-Glazed Pork Ribs Braai with Creamy Pap and Charred Corn
description: Low-and-slow oven ribs finished over a wood-fired braai with a chutney-honey glaze, served with creamy pap and charred corn, plus warm chakalaka on the side.
prep_steps: Set out heavy-duty foil for the ribs.
Mix dry rub in a small bowl: salt, black pepper, and paprika.
Stir glaze in a bowl: chutney, honey, apple cider vinegar, garlic (finely minced), and chilli flakes.
Shuck corn and rub lightly with olive oil and a pinch of salt.
Measure maize meal and milk; set butter nearby.
Prepare braai wood and grid for a two-zone fire (one side medium-hot coals, one side cooler).
cook_steps: Season pork ribs all over with the dry rub. Wrap each rack tightly in foil and place on a tray.
Bake ribs at 160°C for 2 hours until tender but still holding shape.
About 45 minutes before ribs are done, light the braai wood and burn down to steady medium coals.
Transfer the baked ribs (unwrapped) to the cool side of the braai to dry the surface for 5 minutes per side.
Brush ribs generously with the chutney glaze. Move over medium-hot coals and braai 3–4 minutes per side, brushing with more glaze, until lacquered and lightly charred. Rest 10 minutes, then slice.

While ribs finish, set a pot over the braai. Bring milk just to a simmer, then rain in maize meal while stirring. Cook, stirring often, until thick and smooth, 12–15 minutes. Stir in butter and a pinch of salt.
Braai the corn over medium-hot coals, turning often, 8–10 minutes until charred in spots and tender.
Warm chakalaka in a small pot on the cooler side of the braai, stirring occasionally.
Serve sliced glazed ribs with creamy pap, charred corn, and a side of warm chakalaka.

ingredients.quantity: as needed for a medium fire

final_ingredients.quantity: as needed for a medium fire
